<A NAME="eolPage423"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Exhibit B
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CALFORNIA LABOR CODE 2870 NOTICE
</B>
	:
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	California Labor Code Section&nbsp;2870 provides as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any provision in an employment agreement which provides that an employee shall assign, or offer to assign, any of his or her
	rights in an invention to his or her employer shall not apply to an invention that the employee developed entirely on his or her own time without using the employer&#146;s equipment, supplies, facilities, or trade secret information except for those
	inventions that either: (1)&nbsp;relate at the time of conception or reduction to practice of the invention to the employer&#146;s business, or actual or demonstrably anticipated research or development of the employer; or (2)&nbsp;result from any
	work performed by the employee for the employer. To the extent a provision in an employment agreement purports to require an employee to assign an invention otherwise excluded from being required to be assigned under California Labor Code
	Section&nbsp;2870(a), the provision is against the public policy of this state and is unenforceable.
</P>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_10>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage424"></A>
<A NAME="D892618DEX106_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_5"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.6
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	EXECUTIVE EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Executive Employment Agreement (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Agreement
</I>
</B>
	&#148;) is entered into between Audentes Therapeutics, Inc.
	(&#147;
<B>
<I>
	Company
</I>
</B>
	&#148;) and Suyash Prasad (&#147;
<B>
<I>
	Employee
</I>
</B>
	&#148;). This Agreement is effective as of February&nbsp;18, 2014 (&#147;
<B>
<I>
	Effective Date
</I>
</B>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In consideration of the promises and the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, the parties agree as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	1.
<U>
	Position and Duties
</U>
</B>
	. As of the Effective Date, Employee will serve as Senior Vice President and Chief Medical Officer of the
	Company and will report to the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	CEO
</I>
</B>
	&#148;). Employee will render such business and professional services in the performance of his duties, consistent with Employee&#146;s position, as
	shall reasonably be assigned to him by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	2.
<U>
	Exclusive Service
</U>
</B>
	. Employee will be expected to devote his full
	working time and attention to the business of the Company, and will not render services to any other business without the prior approval of the CEO or, directly or indirectly, engage or participate in any business that is competitive in any manner
	with the business of the Company. Employee will also be expected to comply with and be bound by the Company&#146;s operating policies, procedures and practices that are from time to time in effect during the term of his employment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	3.
<U>
	At-Will Employment
</U>
</B>
	. Employee and the Company understand and acknowledge that Employee&#146;s employment with the Company
	constitutes &#147;at-will&#148; employment, and the employment relationship may be terminated at any time, with or without cause and with or without notice. The Company may modify your position, duties, goals, reporting relationship, work location,
	and compensation based on your performance and Company needs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	4.
<U>
	Compensation and Benefits
</U>
</B>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	4.1.
<U>
	Base Salary
</U>
</B>
	. While employed by the Company pursuant to this Agreement, the Company shall pay the Employee an annual base
	salary of $320,000 payable in accordance with the Company&#146;s normal payroll practices. The Company shall periodically review (at least annually) Employee&#146;s compensation and benefits, provided that any changes thereto shall be determined by
	the Company in its sole and absolute discretion. The Employee&#146;s base salary in effect from time to time is referred to herein as the
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Base Salary
</I>
</B>
<I>
	&#148;.
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	4.2.
<U>
	Target Bonus
</U>
</B>
	. Employee will be eligible to receive an annual cash bonus in a target amount equal to 25% of the
	Employee&#146;s Base Salary based on achievement of corporate performance (including financial) objectives to be established from time to time by the Board of Directors (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Board
</I>
</B>
	&#148; and such bonus, the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Target
	Bonus
</I>
</B>
	&#148;) as well as achievement of annual personal performance objectives to be mutually agreed upon in writing between Employee and the Chief Executive Officer. To receive payment of any Target Bonus, Employee must be employed by the
	Company at the time the bonus is paid, such date to be not later than March&nbsp;15 of the year following the year in which the applicable performance objectives are to be measured. Employee will be eligible to receive the Target Bonus in such
	amount and upon such terms as shall be determined by the Board at its sole discretion.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage425"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	4.3.
<U>
	Sign-On Bonus
</U>
</B>
	. Employee will receive a one-time payment of $90,000 as a
	sign-on bonus. The payment is subject to normal payroll practices and will be paid coincidental with the completion of the Employee&#146;s second payroll cycle as an employee of the Company. Should Employee voluntarily resign from the Company prior
	to August&nbsp;18, 2014, the Employee will repay this entire sign-on bonus to the Company within ten (10)&nbsp;business days of the termination date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	4.4.
<U>
	Employee Benefits
</U>
</B>
	. Employee shall be eligible to participate in all employee benefit plans and arrangements, including, but
	not limited to, medical, dental, vision and long-term disability insurance benefits and arrangements, as are made available by the Company to its other senior executives, subject to the terms and conditions thereof, on terms not less favorable than
	are made available to the Company&#146;s other senior executives. The Company reserves the right to modify benefits, contribution, and reimbursement levels from time to time, as it deems necessary.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	4.5.
<U>
	Vacation
</U>
</B>
	. Employee will be entitled to paid vacation and holidays pursuant to the terms of the Company&#146;s vacation
	policy as may exist from time to time but such paid vacation will not be less than fifteen (15)&nbsp;work days per year, prorated for the first year of employment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	5.
<U>
	Stock Options
</U>
</B>
	. Based upon the approval of the Board, the Company will grant Employee an option under the Company&#146;s 2012
	Equity Incentive Plan (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Plan
</I>
</B>
	&#148;) to purchase Two Hundred and Sixteen Thousand (216,000)&nbsp;shares of the Company&#146;s Common Stock (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Option
</I>
</B>
	&#148;). The Option will have an exercise price per share
	equal to the fair market value of a share of the Company&#146;s common stock on the date of grant and will vest over four&nbsp;(4) years, with 25% of the total number of shares subject to the Option vesting on the one-year anniversary of the date of
	grant and the remainder vesting quarterly thereafter in equal installments. Vesting will depend on Employee&#146;s continued service with the Company and will be subject to the terms and conditions of the Plan and the written Stock Option Agreement
	governing the Option. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event of certain separations from service from the Company, the vesting of the Option will be accelerated as set forth in Section&nbsp;9.3. The Board may, in its sole discretion, provide
	Employee with equity grants in addition to the Option set forth above, and the vesting of any such equity grant will be accelerated as set forth in Section 9.3.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	6.
<U>
	Expenses
</U>
</B>
	. The Company will, in accordance with applicable Company policies and guidelines, reimburse Employee for all
	reasonable and necessary expenses incurred by Employee in connection with his performance of services on behalf of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	6.1.
<U>
	Named Expenses for Reimbursement
</U>
</B>
	. The Company will reimburse Employee for the following expenses:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
	On-going costs
	associated with Employee&#146;s reasonable and ordinary expenses incurred in the maintenance of Employee&#146;s license to practice medicine and other associated regulatory bodies&#146; licensing requirements;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	2
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage426"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
	Membership fees in professional associations typically joined by physicians; however,
	the Company&#146;s CEO may limit from time to time the number of such membership fees the Company reimburses; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
	Fees and
	related expenses typically paid by employers in the maintenance of residence or work permits issued by the United States Immigration and Naturalization Service to citizens of foreign countries living and working in the United States, as required by
	Employee. The Company will also reimburse Employee for any costs incurred by Employee as a result of Employee&#146;s previous employer requesting reimbursement for its expenses as set out in this Subsection 6.1(c).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	7.
<U>
	Inventions and Proprietary Information
</U>
</B>
	. Employee hereby acknowledges and agrees that he has executed the Employee Invention
	Assignment and Confidentiality Agreement, effective as of January&nbsp;14, 2014, by and between Employee and the Company, a copy of which is attached hereto as
<U>
	Exhibit&nbsp;B
</U>
	, and that such agreement remains in full force and effect.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	8.
<U>
	Definitions
</U>
</B>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	8.1.
<U>
	Cause
</U>
</B>
	. For purposes of this Agreement, &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Cause
</I>
</B>
	&#148; means (i)&nbsp;Employee&#146;s failure to
	satisfactorily perform Employee&#146;s duties after there has been delivered to Employee a written demand for performance which describes the specific deficiencies in Employee&#146;s performance and the specific manner in which Employee&#146;s
	performance must be improved, and which provides thirty (30)&nbsp;business days from the date of notice to remedy such performance deficiencies; (ii)&nbsp;Employee&#146;s conviction of or plea of nolo contendere to a felony or a crime involving
	moral turpitude which the Board believes has had or will have a detrimental effect on the Company&#146;s reputation or business, (iii)&nbsp;Employee engaging in an act of gross negligence or willful misconduct in the performance of his employment
	obligations and duties, (iv)&nbsp;Employee&#146;s committing an act of fraud against, material misconduct or willful misappropriation of property belonging to the Company; (v)&nbsp;Employee engaging in any other misconduct that has had or will have
	a material adverse effect on the Company&#146;s reputation or business; or (vi)&nbsp;Employee&#146;s breach of the Employee Invention Assignment and Confidentiality Agreement or other unauthorized misuse of the Company&#146;s trade secrets or
	proprietary information.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	8.2.
<U>
	Change in Control
</U>
</B>
	. For purposes of this Agreement &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Change in Control
</I>
</B>
	&#148;
	means (i)&nbsp;a sale, conveyance, exchange or transfer (excluding any venture-backed or similar investments in the Company) in which any person or entity, other than persons or entities who as of immediately prior to such sale, conveyance, exchange
	or transfer own securities in the Company, either directly or indirectly, becomes the beneficial owner, directly or indirectly, of securities of the Company representing more than fifty (50%)&nbsp;percent of the total voting power of all its then
	outstanding voting securities; (ii)&nbsp;a merger or consolidation of the Company in which its voting securities immediately prior to the merger or consolidation do not represent, or are not converted into securities that represent, a majority of
	the voting power of all voting securities of the surviving entity immediately after the merger or consolidation; or (iii)&nbsp;a sale of substantially all of the assets of the Company or a liquidation or dissolution of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	3
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage427"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	8.3.
<U>
	Disability
</U>
</B>
	shall have that meaning set forth in Section&nbsp;22(e)(3) of the
	Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Code
</I>
</B>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	8.4.
<U>
	Good Reason
</U>
</B>
	. For purposes of this
	Agreement, &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Good Reason
</I>
</B>
	&#148; means any of the following taken without the Employee&#146;s written consent and provided (a)&nbsp;the Company receives, within thirty (30)&nbsp;days following the occurrence of any of the events set
	forth in clauses (i)&nbsp;through (iv)&nbsp;below, written notice from the Employee specifying the specific basis for Employee&#146;s belief that Employee is entitled to terminate employment for Good Reason, (b)&nbsp;the Company fails to cure the
	event constituting Good Reason within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after receipt of such written notice thereof, and (c)&nbsp;the Employee terminates employment within the earlier of ten days (10)&nbsp;days following expiration of such cure period or
	receipt from the Company that such deficiencies will not be cured: (i)&nbsp;a material change, adverse to Employee, in Employee&#146;s position, titles, offices or duties; (ii)&nbsp;an assignment of any significant duties to Employee that are
	inconsistent with Employee&#146;s positions or offices held under this Agreement; (iii)&nbsp;a decrease in Employee&#146;s Base Salary by more than 10% (other than in connection with a general decrease in the base salary of all other executive
	officers); or (iv)&nbsp;the relocation of the Employee to a facility or a location more than fifty (50)&nbsp;miles from Employee&#146;s then current location.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	9.
<U>
	Effect of Separation from Service
</U>
</B>
	. For purposes of this Agreement, no payment will be made to Employee upon termination of
	Employee&#146;s employment unless such termination constitutes a &#147;separation from service&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, and Section&nbsp;1.409A-1(h) of the regulations promulgated thereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	9.1.
<U>
	Separation for Cause, Death, Disability or Voluntary Separation from Service
</U>
</B>
	. In the event of any separation from service
	of Employee&#146;s employment by the Company for Cause or in the event of the Employee&#146;s death, Disability or voluntary separation from service at any time and for any reason, the Employee will be paid only (i)&nbsp;any earned but unpaid Base
	Salary, and (ii)&nbsp;other unpaid vested amounts or benefits under the compensation, incentive and benefit plans of the Company in which Employee participates, and (iii)&nbsp;reimbursement for all reasonable and necessary expenses incurred by
	Employee in connection with his performance of services on behalf of the Company in accordance with applicable Company policies and guidelines, in each case as of the effective date of such separation from service (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Accrued
	Compensation
</I>
</B>
	&#148;). Employee will be allowed to exercise his vested stock options to purchase Company common stock, if any, during the time period set forth in, and in accordance with, the Plan and governing stock option agreement(s).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	9.2.
<U>
	Separation from Service without Cause or for Good Reason Prior to a Change in Control
</U>
</B>
	. In the event of the Employee&#146;s
	separation from service from the Company without Cause or for Good Reason, and provided that Employee delivers to the Company a signed settlement agreement and general release of claims in favor of the Company in a form reasonably specified by the
	Company (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Release
</I>
</B>
	&#148;), and satisfies all conditions to make the Release effective, within sixty (60)&nbsp;days following Employee&#146;s separation from service, then, in addition to the Accrued Compensation, Employee shall
	be entitled to the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
	A lump sum cash payment in an amount equal to Six (6)&nbsp;months of Employee&#146;s Base
	Salary, payable on the Ninetieth (90th)&nbsp;day following the date of Employee&#146;s separation from service; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	4
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage428"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
	Provided Employee timely elects to continue health coverage under COBRA, for Employee
	and/or Employee&#146;s eligible dependents, the Company shall reimburse Employee for any monthly COBRA premium payments made by Employee to continue such coverage for the Twelve (12)&nbsp;month period measured from the first month following the
	month in which Employee&#146;s separation from service occurs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	9.3.
<U>
	Separation from Service Following a Change in Control
</U>
</B>
	.
	In the event of the Employee&#146;s separation from service from the Company without Cause or for Good Reason, in each case during the period of time commencing ninety (90)&nbsp;days prior to the execution of a definitive agreement providing for the
	consummation of a Change in Control and ending on the first anniversary of the consummation of such Change in Control, and provided that Employee delivers to the Company the signed Release, and satisfies all conditions to make the Release effective,
	within sixty (60)&nbsp;days following Employee&#146;s separation from service, then, in addition to the Accrued Compensation, Employee shall be entitled to the benefits as set forth below:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
	The payments set forth above in Sections 9.2(a) and (b);
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
	Acceleration as to 100% of the unvested shares subject to the Option; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
	Acceleration as to 100% of the unvested portion of any other equity award granted to the Employee following the Effective Date.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the avoidance of doubt, the severance payments and benefits payable pursuant to Section&nbsp;9.2 or Section&nbsp;9.3 above are not cumulative.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	9.4.
<U>
	Parachute Payments
</U>
</B>
	. In the event that the severance and other benefits provided for in this Agreement or otherwise payable
	to the Employee (i)&nbsp;constitute &#147;parachute payments&#148; within the meaning of Section&nbsp;280G of the Code and (ii)&nbsp;but for this Section, would be subject to the excise tax imposed by Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code, then,
	Employee&#146;s severance and other benefits under this Agreement shall be payable either (i)&nbsp;in full, or (ii)&nbsp;as to such lesser amount which would result in no portion of such severance and other benefits being subject to the excise tax
	under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code, whichever of the foregoing amounts, taking into account the applicable federal, state and local income taxes and the excise tax imposed by Section&nbsp;4999, results in the receipt by Employee on an after-tax
	basis, of the greatest amount of severance benefits under this Agreement, notwithstanding that all or some portion of such severance benefits may be taxable under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code. Any reduction shall be made in the following manner:
	first a pro rata reduction of (i)&nbsp;cash payments subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Code as deferred compensation and (ii)&nbsp;cash payments not subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, and second a pro rata cancellation of
	(i)&nbsp;equity-based compensation subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Code as deferred compensation and (ii)&nbsp;equity-based compensation not subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Code. Reduction in either cash payments or equity compensation
	benefits
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	5
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage429"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	shall be made prorata between and among benefits which are subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Code and benefits which are exempt from Section&nbsp;409A of the Code. Unless the Company and
	Employee otherwise agree in writing, any determination required under this Section shall be made in writing by the Company&#146;s independent public accountants (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Accountants
</I>
</B>
	&#148;), whose determination shall be conclusive and
	binding upon Employee and the Company for all purposes. For purposes of making the calculations required by this Section, the Accountants may make reasonable assumptions and approximations concerning applicable taxes and may rely on reasonable, good
	faith interpretations concerning the application of Sections 280G and 4999 of the Code. The Company and Employee shall furnish to the Accountants such information and documents as the Accountants may reasonably request in order to make a
	determination under this Section. The Company shall bear all costs the Accountants may reasonably incur in connection with any calculations contemplated by this Section.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.
<U>
	Miscellaneous
</U>
</B>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.1.
<U>
	Arbitration
</U>
</B>
	. Employee and the Company agree to submit to mandatory binding arbitration, in Santa Clara County, California,
	any and all claims arising out of or related to this agreement and Employee&#146;s employment with the Company and the termination thereof, except that each party may, at its or his option, seek injunctive relief in court related to the improper
	use, disclosure or misappropriation of a party&#146;s proprietary, confidential or trade secret information. EMPLOYEE AND THE COMPANY HEREBY WAIVE ANY RIGHTS TO TRIAL BY JURY IN REGARD TO SUCH CLAIMS. This agreement to arbitrate does not restrict
	Employee&#146;s right to file administrative claims. Employee may bring before any government agency where, as a matter of law, the parties may not restrict the employee&#146;s ability to file such claims (including, but not limited to, the National
	Labor Relations Board, the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission and the Department of Labor). However, Employee and the Company agree that, to the fullest extent permitted by law, arbitration shall be the exclusive remedy for the subject matter
	of such administrative claims. The arbitration shall be conducted through JAMS before a single neutral arbitrator, in accordance with the JAMS employment arbitration rules then in effect. The arbitrator shall issue a written decision that contains
	the essential findings and conclusions on which the decision is based.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.2.
<U>
	Indemnification
</U>
</B>
	. Employee will be named as an
	insured on the director and officer liability insurance policy currently maintained, or as may be maintained by the Company from time to time, and, in addition, Employee will enter into the form of indemnification agreement provided to other
	similarly situated executive officers and directors of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.3.
<U>
	Section 409A
</U>
</B>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(a)
</B>
	To the extent (a)&nbsp;any payments or benefits to which Employee becomes entitled under this Agreement, or under any agreement or
	plan referenced herein, in connection with Employee&#146;s termination of employment with the Company constitute deferred compensation subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Code and (b)&nbsp;Employee is deemed at the time of such termination of
	employment to be a &#147;specified employee&#148; under Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, then such payments shall not be made or commence until the earliest of (i)&nbsp;the expiration of the six (6)-month period measured from the date of
	Employee&#146;s &#147;separation from service&#148; (as such
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	6
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage430"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	term is at the time defined in Treasury Regulations under Section&nbsp;409A of the Code) from the Company; or (ii)&nbsp;the date of Employee&#146;s death following such separation from service;
	provided, however, that such deferral shall only be effected to the extent required to avoid adverse tax treatment to Employee, including (without limitation) the additional twenty percent (20%)&nbsp;tax for which Employee would otherwise be liable
	under Section&nbsp;409A(a)(1)(B) of the Code in the absence of such deferral. Upon the expiration of the applicable deferral period, any payments which would have otherwise been made during that period (whether in a single sum or in installments) in
	the absence of this paragraph shall be paid to Employee or Employee&#146;s beneficiary in one lump sum (without interest).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(b)
</B>
	Any
	termination of Employee&#146;s employment is intended to constitute a &#147;separation from service&#148; and will be determined consistent with the rules relating to a &#147;separation from service&#148; as such term is defined in Treasury
	Regulation Section&nbsp;1.409A-1.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(c)
</B>
	It is intended that each installment of the payments provided hereunder constitute separate
	&#147;payments&#148; for purposes of Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.409A-2(b)(2)(i). It is further intended that payments hereunder satisfy, to the greatest extent possible, the exemptions from the application of Section&nbsp;409A of the Code
	(and any state law of similar effect) provided under Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.409A-1(b)(4) (as a &#147;short-term deferral&#148;) and/or Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.409A-1(b)(9) (iii)&nbsp;(as &#147;involuntary separation
	pay&#148;). To the extent that any provision of this Agreement is ambiguous as to its compliance with Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, the provision will be read in such a manner so that all payments hereunder comply with Section&nbsp;409A of the
	Code.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(d)
</B>
	Notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth in this Agreement, if any payment under this Agreement subject to
	execution of a release is subject to the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, in no event will the timing of the execution of the release, directly or indirectly, result in Employee designating the calendar year of payment, and if a
	payment that is subject to execution of the release could be made in more than one taxable year, payment will be made in the later taxable year.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(e)
</B>
	Except as otherwise expressly provided herein, to the extent any expense reimbursement or the provision of any in-kind benefit
	under this Agreement is determined to be subject to Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, the amount of any such expenses eligible for reimbursement, or the provision of any in-kind benefit, in one calendar year shall not affect the expenses eligible for
	reimbursement in any other taxable year (except for any lifetime or other aggregate limitation applicable to medical expenses), in no event shall any expenses be reimbursed after the last day of the calendar year following the calendar year in which
	you incurred such expenses, and in no event shall any right to reimbursement or the provision of any in-kind benefit be subject to liquidation or exchange for another benefit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.4.
<U>
	Outside Professional Activities
</U>
</B>
	. Employee may be called upon from time to time to participate in professional activities
	related to Employee&#146;s expertise and standing in his profession, including but not limited to, participation in profit or not-for-profit boards of directors, scientific advisory boards, data monitoring committees, or expert industry panels.
	Employee may also have an interest in participating in similar outside activities in furtherance of his general knowledge that might benefit the Company. Employee may participate in such
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	7
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage431"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	outside activities as long as: 1)&nbsp;such outside activity does not conflict with the interests of the Company; 2)&nbsp;Employee does not simultaneously sit on more than two outside boards,
	panels, committees or the like; and, 3)&nbsp;the CEO is informed of Employee&#146;s potential participation in such outside activity prior to Employee&#146;s commitment to participate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.5.
<U>
	Authorship of Publications
</U>
</B>
	. Inherent in Employee&#146;s professional activities is the authorship of scientific and
	clinical articles related to the Company&#146;s research and development. Prior to becoming an employee of the Company, Employee may have also authored such articles on behalf of his previous employer. Should employee find it necessary to complete
	work on such articles on behalf of his previous employer, the Company will permit this to occur without attribution to the Company. Future publications, related to the Company&#146;s research and development, may be authored and published by
	Employee as long as they are in accord with the Company policies and objectives at that time, and are prior approved by the CEO or his designee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.6.
<U>
	Severability
</U>
</B>
	. If any provision of this Agreement shall be found by any arbitrator or court of competent jurisdiction to be
	invalid or unenforceable, then the parties hereby waive such provision to the extent of its invalidity or unenforceability, and agree that all other provisions in this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.7.
<U>
	No Waiver
</U>
</B>
	. The failure by either party at any time to require performance or compliance by the other of any of its
	obligations or agreements shall in no way affect the right to require such performance or compliance at any time thereafter. The waiver by either party of a breach of any provision hereof shall not be taken or held to be a waiver of any preceding or
	succeeding breach of such provision or as a waiver of the provision itself. No waiver of any kind shall be effective or binding, unless it is in writing and is signed by the party against whom such waiver is sought to be enforced.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.8.
<U>
	Assignment
</U>
</B>
	. This Agreement and all rights hereunder are personal to Employee and may not be transferred or assigned by
	Employee at any time. The Company may assign its rights, together with its obligations hereunder, to any parent, subsidiary, affiliate or successor, or in connection with any sale, transfer or other disposition of all or substantially all of its
	business and assets, provided, however, that any such assignee assumes the Company&#146;s obligations hereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.9.
<U>
	Withholding
</U>
</B>
	. All sums payable to Employee hereunder shall be in United States Dollars and shall be reduced by all federal, state, local and other withholding and similar taxes and payments required by applicable law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.10.
<U>
	Entire Agreement
</U>
</B>
	. This Agreement (and the exhibit(s) hereto) constitutes the entire and only agreement and understanding
	between the parties relating to Employee&#146;s employment with Company. This Agreement supersedes and cancels any and all previous contracts, arrangements or understandings other than the exhibits hereto with respect to Employee&#146;s employment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.11.
<U>
	Amendment
</U>
</B>
	. The parties understand and agree that this Agreement may not be amended, modified or waived, in whole or
	in part, except in a writing executed by (i)&nbsp;Employee and (ii)&nbsp;either (A)&nbsp;an authorized executive officer of the Company or (B)&nbsp;an authorized independent member of the Board, in each case, other than Employee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	8
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage432"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.12.
<U>
	Notices
</U>
</B>
	. All notices, if any, and all other communications, if any, required
	or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and hand delivered, sent via facsimile, sent by registered first class mail, postage pre-paid, or sent by nationally recognized express courier service. Such notices and other communications
	shall be effective upon receipt if hand delivered or sent via facsimile, five (5)&nbsp;days after mailing if sent by mail, and one&nbsp;(1) day after dispatch if sent by express courier, to the following addresses, or such other addresses as any
	party shall notify the other parties:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.13.
<U>
	Binding Nature
</U>
</B>
	. This Agreement shall be binding upon, and inure to the benefit of, the
	successors and personal representatives of the respective parties hereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.14.
<U>
	Counterparts
</U>
</B>
	. This Agreement may be
	executed in two or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed to be an original but all of which, taken together, constitute one and the same agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.15.
<U>
	Governing Law
</U>
</B>
	. This Agreement and the rights and obligations of the parties hereto shall be construed in accordance with
	the laws of the State of California, without giving effect to the principles of conflict of laws.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

	9

	IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Company and Employee have executed this Agreement as of the date first
	above written.
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage434"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	EXHIBIT A
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Employee Invention Assignment and Confidentiality Agreement
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage435"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/11/0001193125-16-644856_G892622G49K09.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Exhibit A
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	EMPLOYEE INVENTION ASSIGNMENT AND
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CONFIDENTIALITY AGREEMENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In consideration of, and as a condition of my employment with Audentes Therapeutics, Inc., a Delaware corporation with its principal offices
	in the State of California (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Company
</I>
</B>
	&#148;), I, as the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Employee
</I>
</B>
	&#148; signing this Employee Invention Assignment and Confidentiality Agreement (this &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Agreement
</I>
</B>
	&#148;), hereby represent to
	the Company, and the Company and I hereby agree as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	1.
<U>
	Purpose of Agreement
</U>
</B>
	. I understand that the Company is
	engaged in a continuous program of research, development, production and/or marketing in connection with its current and projected business and that it is critical for the Company to preserve and protect its proprietary information, its rights in
	certain inventions and works and in related intellectual property rights. Accordingly, I am entering into this Agreement, whether or not I am expected to create inventions or other works of value for the Company. As used in this Agreement,
	&#147;
<B>
<I>
	Inventions
</I>
</B>
	&#148; means inventions, improvements, designs, original works of authorship, formulas, processes, compositions of matter, computer software programs, databases, mask works, confidential information and trade secrets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	2.
<U>
	Disclosure of Inventions
</U>
</B>
	. I will promptly disclose in confidence to the Company, or to any person designated by it, all
	Inventions that I make, create, conceive or first reduce to practice, either alone or jointly with others, during the period of my employment, whether or not in the course of my employment, and whether or not patentable, copyrightable or protectable
	as trade secrets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	3.
<U>
	Work for Hire; Assigned Inventions
</U>
</B>
	. I acknowledge and agree that any copyrightable works prepared by
	me within the scope of my employment will be &#147;works made for hire&#148; under the Copyright Act and that the Company will be considered the author and owner of such copyrightable works. I agree that all Inventions that I make, create, conceive
	or first reduce to practice during the period of my employment, whether or not in the course of my employment, and whether or not patentable, copyrightable or protectable as trade secrets, and that (i)&nbsp;are developed using equipment, supplies,
	facilities or trade secrets of the Company; (ii)&nbsp;result from work performed by me for the Company; or (iii)&nbsp;relate to the Company&#146;s business or actual or demonstrably anticipated research or development (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Assigned
	Inventions
</I>
</B>
	&#148;), will be the sole and exclusive property of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	4.
<U>
	Excluded Inventions and Other
	Inventions
</U>
</B>
	. Attached hereto as
<U>
	Attachment A
</U>
	is a list describing all existing Inventions, if any, that may relate to the Company&#146;s business or actual or demonstrably anticipated research or development and that were made by me or
	acquired by me prior to the Effective Date (as defined in
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	101 Montgomery Street
	&#149; Suite 2650 &#149; San Francisco &#149; CA &#149; 94104 &#149; USA
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	www.audentestx.com
</B>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage436"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/11/0001193125-16-644856_G892622G49K09.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Section&nbsp;25, below), and which are not to be assigned to the Company (&#147;
<B>
<I>
	Excluded Inventions
</I>
</B>
	&#148;). If no such list is attached, I represent and agree that it is because I
	have no rights in any existing Inventions that may relate to the Company&#146;s business or actual or demonstrably anticipated research or development. For purposes of this Agreement, &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Other Inventions
</I>
</B>
	&#148; means Inventions in
	which I have or may have an interest, as of the Effective Date or thereafter, other than Assigned Inventions and Excluded Inventions. I acknowledge and agree that if, in the scope of my employment, I use any Excluded Inventions or any Other
	Inventions, or if I include any Excluded Inventions or Other Inventions in any product or service of the Company or if my rights in any Excluded Inventions or Other Inventions may block or interfere with, or may otherwise be required for, the
	exercise by the Company of any rights assigned to the Company under this Agreement, I will immediately so notify the Company in writing. Unless the Company and I agree otherwise in writing as to particular Excluded Inventions or Other Inventions, I
	hereby grant to the Company, in such circumstances (whether or not I give the Company notice as required above), a perpetual, irrevocable, nonexclusive, transferable, world-wide, royalty-free license to use, disclose, make, sell, offer for sale,
	import, copy, distribute, modify and create works based on, perform, and display such Excluded Inventions and Other Inventions, and to sublicense third parties in one or more tiers of sublicensees with the same rights.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	5.
<U>
	Exception to Assignment
</U>
</B>
	. I understand that the Assigned Inventions will not include, and the provisions of this Agreement
	requiring assignment of inventions to the Company do not apply to, any invention that qualifies fully for exclusion under the provisions of Section&nbsp;2870 of the California Labor Code, which are attached hereto as
<U>
	Attachment&nbsp;B
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	6.
<U>
	Assignment of Rights
</U>
</B>
	. I agree to assign, and do hereby irrevocably transfer and assign, to the Company: (i)&nbsp;all of my
	rights, title and interests in and with respect to any Assigned Inventions; (ii)&nbsp;all patents, patent applications, copyrights, mask works, rights in databases, trade secrets, and other intellectual property rights, worldwide, in any Assigned
	Inventions, along with any registrations of or applications to register such rights; and (iii)&nbsp;to the extent assignable, any and all Moral Rights (as defined below) that I may have in or with respect to any Assigned Inventions. I also hereby
	forever waive and agree never to assert any Moral Rights I may have in or with respect to any Assigned Inventions and any Excluded Inventions or Other Inventions licensed to the Company under Section&nbsp;4, even after termination of my employment
	with the Company. &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Moral Rights
</I>
</B>
	&#148; means any rights to claim authorship of a work, to object to or prevent the modification or destruction of a work, to withdraw from circulation or control the publication or distribution of a
	work, and any similar right, regardless of whether or not such right is denominated or generally referred to as a &#147;moral right.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	101 Montgomery Street
	&#149; Suite 2650 &#149; San Francisco &#149; CA &#149; 94104 &#149; USA
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	www.audentestx.com
</B>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage437"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/11/0001193125-16-644856_G892622G49K09.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	7.
<U>
	Assistance
</U>
</B>
	. I will assist the Company in every proper way to obtain and
	enforce for the Company all patents, copyrights, mask work rights, trade secret rights and other legal protections for the Assigned Inventions, worldwide. I will execute and deliver any documents that the Company may reasonably request from me in
	connection with providing such assistance. My obligations under this section will continue beyond the termination of my employment with the Company;
<U>
	provided
</U>
	that the Company agrees to compensate me at a reasonable rate after such termination
	for time and expenses actually spent by me at the Company&#146;s request in providing such assistance. I hereby appoint the Secretary of the Company as my attorney-in-fact to execute documents on my behalf for this purpose. I agree that this
	appointment is coupled with an interest and will not be revocable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	8.
<U>
	Proprietary Information
</U>
</B>
	. I understand that my
	employment by the Company creates a relationship of confidence and trust with respect to any information or materials of a confidential or secret nature that may be made, created or discovered by me or that may be disclosed to me by the Company or a
	third party in relation to the business of the Company or to the business of any parent, subsidiary, affiliate, customer or supplier of the Company, or any other party with whom the Company agrees to hold such information or materials in confidence
	(the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Proprietary Information
</I>
</B>
	&#148;). Without limitation as to the forms that Proprietary Information may take, I acknowledge that Proprietary Information may be contained in tangible material such as writings, drawings, samples,
	electronic media, or computer programs, or may be in the nature of unwritten knowledge or know-how. Proprietary Information includes, but is not limited to, Assigned Inventions, marketing plans, product plans, designs, data, prototypes, specimens,
	test protocols, laboratory notebooks, business strategies, financial information, forecasts, personnel information, contract information, customer and supplier lists, and the non-public names and addresses of the Company&#146;s customers and
	suppliers, their buying and selling habits and special needs.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	9.
<U>
	Confidentiality
</U>
</B>
	. At all times, both during my employment
	and after its termination, I will keep and hold all Proprietary Information in strict confidence and trust. I will not use or disclose any Proprietary Information without the prior written consent of the Company in each instance, except as may be
	necessary to perform my duties as an employee of the Company for the benefit of the Company. Upon termination of my employment with the Company, I will promptly deliver to the Company all documents and materials of any nature pertaining to my work
	with the Company, and I will not take with me or retain in any form any documents or materials or copies containing any Proprietary Information.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	10.
<U>
	Physical Property
</U>
</B>
	. All documents, supplies, equipment and other physical property furnished to me by the Company or produced
	by me or others in connection with my employment will be and remain the sole property of the Company. I will return to the
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	101 Montgomery Street
	&#149; Suite 2650 &#149; San Francisco &#149; CA &#149; 94104 &#149; USA
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	www.audentestx.com
</B>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage438"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/11/0001193125-16-644856_G892622G49K09.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Company all such items when requested by the Company, excepting only my personal copies of records relating to my employment or compensation and any personal property I bring with me to the
	Company and designate as such. Even if the Company does not so request, I will upon termination of my employment return to the Company all Company property, and I will not take with me or retain any such items.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	11.
<U>
	No Breach of Prior Agreements
</U>
</B>
	. I represent that my performance of all the terms of this Agreement and my duties as an
	employee of the Company will not breach any invention assignment, proprietary information, confidentiality, non-competition, or other agreement with any former employer or other party. I represent that I will not bring with me to the Company or use
	in the performance of my duties for the Company any documents or materials or intangibles of my own or of a former employer or third party that are not generally available for use by the public or have not been legally transferred to the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	12.
<U>
	&#147;At Will&#148; Employment
</U>
</B>
	. I understand that this Agreement does not constitute a contract of employment or
	obligate the Company to employ me for any stated period of time. I understand that I am an &#147;at will&#148; employee of the Company and that my employment can be terminated at any time, with or without notice and with or without cause, for any
	reason or for no reason, by either the Company or by me. I acknowledge that any statements or representations to the contrary are ineffective, unless put into a writing signed by the Company. I further acknowledge that my participation in any stock
	option or benefit program is not to be construed as any assurance of continuing employment for any particular period of time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	13.
<U>
	Company Opportunities; Duty Not to Compete
</U>
</B>
	. During the period of my employment, I will at all times devote my best efforts to the interests of the Company, and I will not, without the prior written consent of the Company, engage in, or
	encourage or assist others to engage in, any other employment or activity that: (i)&nbsp;would divert from the Company any business opportunity in which the Company can reasonably be expected to have an interest; (ii)&nbsp;would directly compete
	with, or involve preparation to compete with, the current or future business of the Company; or (iii)&nbsp;would otherwise conflict with the Company&#146;s interests or could cause a disruption of its operations or prospects.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	14.
<U>
	Non-Solicitation of Employees/Consultants
</U>
</B>
	. During my employment with the Company and for a one (1)&nbsp;year period
	thereafter, I will not directly or indirectly solicit away employees or consultants of the Company for my own benefit or for the benefit of any other person or entity, nor will I encourage or assist others to do so.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	15.
<U>
	Use of Name&nbsp;&amp; Likeness
</U>
</B>
	. I hereby authorize the Company to use, reuse, and to grant others the right to use and
	reuse, my name, photograph, likeness (including caricature), voice, and biographical information, and any reproduction or simulation thereof, in any form of media or technology now known or hereafter developed, both during and after my employment,
	for any purposes related to the Company&#146;s business, such as marketing, advertising, credits, and presentations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	101 Montgomery Street
	&#149; Suite 2650 &#149; San Francisco &#149; CA &#149; 94104 &#149; USA
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	www.audentestx.com
</B>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage439"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/07/11/0001193125-16-644856_G892622G49K09.JPG" ALT="LOGO">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	16.
<U>
	Notification
</U>
</B>
	. I hereby authorize the Company, during and after the
	termination of my employment with the Company, to notify third parties, including, but not limited to, actual or potential customers or employers, of the terms of this Agreement and my responsibilities hereunder.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	17.
<U>
	Injunctive Relief
</U>
</B>
	. I understand that a breach or threatened breach of this Agreement by me may cause the Company to suffer
	irreparable harm and that the Company will therefore be entitled to injunctive relief to enforce this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	18.
<U>
	Governing Law;
	Severability
</U>
</B>
	. This Agreement is intended to supplement, and not to supersede, any rights the Company may have in law or equity with respect to the duties of its employees and the protection of its trade secrets. This Agreement will be
	governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California without giving effect to any principles of conflict of laws that would lead to the application of the laws of another jurisdiction. If any provision of this Agreement
	is invalid, illegal or unenforceable in any respect, such provision will be enforced to the maximum extent possible, given the fundamental intentions of the parties when entering into this Agreement. To the extent such provision cannot be so
	enforced, it will be stricken from this Agreement and the remainder of this Agreement will be enforced as if such invalid, illegal or unenforceable provision had never been contained in this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	19.
<U>
	Counterparts
</U>
</B>
	. This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which when so executed and delivered
	will be deemed an original, and all of which together will constitute one and the same agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	20.
<U>
	Entire Agreement
</U>
</B>
	.
	This Agreement and the documents referred to herein constitute the entire agreement and understanding of the parties with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement, and supersede all prior understandings and agreements, whether oral or
	written, between the parties hereto with respect to such subject matter.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	21.
<U>
	Amendment and Waiver
</U>
</B>
	. This Agreement may be
	amended only by a written agreement executed by each of the parties to this Agreement. No amendment or waiver of, or modification of any obligation under, this Agreement will be enforceable unless specifically set forth in a writing signed by the
	party against which enforcement is sought. A waiver by either party of any of the terms and conditions of this Agreement in any instance will not be deemed or construed to be a waiver of such term or condition with respect to any other instance,
	whether prior, concurrent or subsequent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">

	101 Montgomery Street
	&#149; Suite 2650 &#149; San Francisco &#149; CA &#149; 94104 &#149; USA

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	22.
<U>
	Successors and Assigns; Assignment
</U>
</B>
	. Except as otherwise provided in this
	Agreement, this Agreement, and the rights and obligations of the parties hereunder, will bind and benefit the parties and their respective successors, assigns, heirs, executors, administrators, and legal representatives. The Company may assign any
	of its rights and obligations under this Agreement. I understand that I will not be entitled to assign or delegate this Agreement or any of my rights or obligations hereunder, whether voluntarily or by operation of law, except with the prior written
	consent of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	23.
<U>
	Further Assurances
</U>
</B>
	. The parties will execute such further documents and instruments and take
	such further actions as may be reasonably necessary to carry out the purposes and intent of this Agreement. Upon termination of my employment with the Company, I will execute and deliver a document or documents in a form reasonably requested by the
	Company confirming my agreement to comply with the post-employment obligations contained in this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	24.
<U>
	Acknowledgement
</U>
</B>
	. I certify and acknowledge that I have carefully read all of the provisions of this Agreement and that I understand and will fully and faithfully comply with this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	25.
<U>
	Effective Date of Agreement
</U>
</B>
	. This Agreement is and will be effective on and after the first day of my employment by the
	Company, which is
<U>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</U>
	,
<U>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</U>
	(the
	&#147;
<B>
<I>
	Effective Date
</I>
</B>
	&#148;).
</P>
